instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3330-B fan spin no boot
threads.message:
howdy howdy howdy, I've got an 820-3330 that won't boot (no chime, no no-ram beep, no USB mouse lightup), PCH gets nice and toasty and is giving me trash instead of SPI_MLB_CLK. 

I assume the PCH is fucked, but I'd love for it not to be . help computah!

threads.title: 820-3330-B fan spin no boot
threads.message: History, liquid? Is CPU Vcore present?

threads.title: 820-3330-B fan spin no boot
threads.message: wow, I would have sworn I checked already but I'm only .914v on ppvcore_s0_cpu_reg

threads.title: 820-3330-B fan spin no boot
threads.message: I see no issue with that. What about my other question?

threads.title: 820-3330-B fan spin no boot
threads.message:
sorry, brain got retarded there and thought that was the problem.

power button LSI sensor hit, edge bonding gone from the GPU, flux under it. no clue about the history, I have a friend who is keeping an eye out for an 820-3330 for me and this is one he tracked down DOA. 

u4800 area has a few darkened probe points below it, a bit of residue around battery connector, bios, and u5010. hmm, getting 2.7 on pin 4, and 3.28 on 5-8.

threads.title: 820-3330-B fan spin no boot
threads.message: So this is a garbage board that was fucked with. GPU was messed with. Really this board could have so much wrong with it at this stage I doubt you want to waste time on this. If you really want to, first thing is to install a new GPU and probably VRAM. U4800 is not important and if U5010 had an issue it would not even power on. BIOS area is VERY important of course, so maybe look at that for corroded resistors and traces.
